name: Iris Hub
description: Iris Hub provides an API to allow vendor to vendor communication and purchasing. One way to think about the hub is a modern EDI - very simple REST interface to enable purchasing and fulfillment between two vendors.

user.description: A user is a top level person interacting with Iris Hub.

fields.name: guid
fields.description: Internal unique identifier for this user.

vendor.description: A vendor is one of the main concepts in IRIS HUB. All activity is tied to a vendor.

fields.name: guid
fields.description: Uniquely identifies this vendor

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of this vendor - just used as a label for people to read.

fields.name: key
fields.description: A unique, url friendly key for this vendor. keys are always stored in lower case.

vendor_tag.description: A user can apply one or more tags to a vendor. Tags are private to the user. When creating a vendor, you can also specify a tag to create a vendor tag transactionally which is a useful tool for attaching your own identifier to all vendors.

fields.name: guid
fields.description: Uniquely identifies this vendor tag.

fields.name: user_guid
fields.description: TODO: Change type to user

fields.name: tag
fields.description: The actual tag you have applied to this vendor

item.description: An item represents a physical or virtual thing that can be purchased.

fields.name: guid
fields.description: Uniquely identifies this record

fields.name: number
fields.description: This is the vendor's unique identifier for this item. The item number is case sensitive.

fields.name: quantity
fields.description: The number of units that this vendor currently has available for sale.

fields.name: retail
fields.description: The retail price for this item

fields.name: sale
fields.description: The retail price for this item

fields.name: cost
fields.description: The retail price for this item

term.description: Represents the terms by which two vendors are transacting. Primary purpose is to capture things like 'NET30' so that both parties can correctly invoice and pay.

fields.name: guid
fields.description: Uniquely identifies this record

fields.name: code
fields.description: An identifier that people at both vendors understand (e.g. NET30).

fields.name: description
fields.description: Description to help people understand the intent of the terms (e.g. Payment is due 30 days after receipt of invoice)

agreement.description: An agreement outlines the terms by which two vendors work together.

fields.name: guid
fields.description: Uniquely identifies this agreement

fields.name: identifier
fields.description: A human readable unique identifier for this agreement. Format will be something like IA2014-123456 - IA: Iris Agreement followed by the year followed by a number.

fields.name: purchasing_vendor
fields.description: The vendor that will be purchasing items - i.e. the vendor that will be responsible for creating the Purchases in Iris Hub

fields.name: fulfilling_vendor
fields.description: The vendor that will be fulfilling items - i.e. the vendor that will be responsible for receiving a shipment request and actually shipping the goods.

fields.name: term
fields.description: The specific payment terms in place for this agreement

fields.name: begin_datetime
fields.description: The date on which this agreement goes into effect.

fields.name: end_datetime
fields.description: The date on which this agreement ends. If not specified, this agreement is considered perpetual and it never ends.

fields.name: currency
fields.description: Determines the currency in which transactions pertaining to this agreement are made. The value is the 3-character upper case iso4217 code for this currency

shipment_schedule.description: A shipment schedule defines how frequently a vendor would like to ship. A common use case is to ship every week on monday. IRIS will then aggregate pending purchases into a single shipment request on Mondays for the vendor to ship in bulk.

fields.name: guid
fields.description: Uniquely identifies this record

fields.name: frequency
fields.description: supported values: immediate (e.g. for drop ship orders create shipment requests immediately following purchase), daily (create one shipment request / day), weekly (create one shipment request / week).

fields.name: begin_datetime
fields.description: Date on which to start schedule. For daily/weekly schedules, determines the day of the week on which to generate a shipment request

planned_shipment.description: A date of the next planned shipment (tied to the closure of the shipment request). It's based on the shipment schedule frequency and begin_datetime

fields.name: datetime
fields.description: The date and time of an upcoming shipment.

address.description: Represents a physical address - e.g. an address to where to ship goods

fields.name: guid
fields.description: Uniquely idenfies this address

purchase.description: A purchase represents one vendor purchasing one unit of an item from another vendor. In many ERP systems, the purchase will map to the concept of an order item - e.g. one item on an order. IRIS operates solely on the level of line items to provide a simple interface that gracefully handles many of the operational differences that occur in real life including short shipments, split shipments, etc. Each purchase a destination address which represents the recipient of the purchase - i.e. where the item should be delivered.

fields.name: guid
fields.description: Uniquely identifies this record

fields.name: vendor_purchase_number
fields.description: Unique identifier in vendor's system for this purchase. This token is used to ensure that a purchase is not duplicated in IRIS

fields.name: price
fields.description: Price of the item being purchased. Currency is that of the agreement.

shipment_request.description: A shipment request refers to a collection of items that the fulfilling vendor should now ship to a single address, subject to the terms of a single agreement. Conceptually - a shipment request relates to one order that the vendor must now ship - containing at least 1 item in it.

fields.name: guid
fields.description: Uniquely identifies this record

fields.name: identifier
fields.description: A human readable unique identifier for this shipment request. Format will be something like SR2014-123456 - SR: Shipment Request followed by the year followed by a number.

shipment_request_item.description: Represents the list of items inside one shipment request.

fields.name: item_number
fields.description: The fulfilling vendor's number

fields.name: quantity
fields.description: The quantity requested for this item

receipt.description: A receipt represents a single unit of merchandise that was received.

fields.name: guid
fields.description: Uniquely identifies this record

fields.name: vendor_receipt_number
fields.description: Uniquely identifies this receipt in the vendor system. Main purpose is to guarantee idempotence

operations.description: Search all vendors. Results are always paginated.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Finds the vendor with this name. Exact match

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: Finds the vendor with this key. Exact match

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of records to return

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Used to paginate. First page of results is 0.

items.description: Search all items. Results are always paginated.

parameters.name: agreement_guid
parameters.description: Fetches items for the fulfilling vendor according to the specific agreement guid.

items.description: Gets the detailed view of this item, including the full json document of all of the attributes.
Allows an incremental update to an existing item.

terms.description: Search all terms. Results are always paginated.

agreements.description: Search all agreements. Results are always paginated.

parameters.name: currency
parameters.description: 3-character upper case iso4217 code for this currency

shipment_schedules.description: Search all shipment requests. Results are always paginated.

planned_shipments.description: Returns the upcoming planned shipments for a given agreement, filtered by a certain number of days. For example, you can request all planned shipments in the next 30 days - you will then see the actual upcoming dates, if any, that an open shipment request will be cloesd. Results are always paginated.

purchases.description: Search all purchases. Results are always paginated.
Returns the purchase with this guid.

parameters.name: price
parameters.description: Price of the item being purchased. Currency is that of the agreement.

shipment_requests.description: Search all shipment requests. Results are always paginated.
Closes an open shipment request ahead of schedule.

shipment_request_items.description: Retrieve the items in a shipment request. Results are always paginated.
